DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Giving low dos chemotherapy , fludarabine busulfan , donor peripheral blood stem cell transplant help stop growth cancer cell . It also stop patient 's immune system reject donor 's stem cell . The donated stem cell may replace patient 's immune system help destroy remain cancer cell ( graft-versus-tumor effect ) . Giving infusion donor 's T cell ( donor lymphocyte infusion ) transplant may help increase effect . Sometimes transplanted cell donor also make immune response body 's normal cell . Giving cyclosporine mycophenolate mofetil transplant may stop happen . PURPOSE : This phase I/II trial study side effect give busulfan fludarabine together total-body irradiation see well work treat patient undergo donor stem cell transplant hematologic cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Busulfan , Fludarabine , Total-Body Irradiation Treating Patients Who Are Undergoing Donor Stem Cell Transplant Hematologic Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - To assess safety toxicity addition busulfan add establish fludarabine low-dose total-body irradiation ( TBI ) condition regimen non-myeloablative allogeneic transplantation patient hematologic malignancy . ( Phase I ) - To assess non-relapse mortality 1-year conditioning busulfan fludarabine/TBI patient hematologic malignancy moderate high risk graft rejection and/or relapse underlying disease . ( Phase II ) Secondary - To assess overall survival 1-year survival . ( Phase II ) - To assess incidence graft rejection . ( Phase II ) - To assess incidence grade II-IV acute graft-vs-host disease ( GVHD ) chronic extensive GVHD . ( Phase II ) - To assess rate disease progression and/or relapse-related mortality . ( Phase II ) - To determine non-hematologic grade III-IV organ specific toxicity . ( Phase II ) OUTLINE : - Nonmyeloablative-conditioning regimen : Patients receive busulfan IV day -5 fludarabine IV 30 minute day -4 -2 . Patients undergo total body irradiation day 0 . - Allogeneic peripheral blood stem cell transplantation ( PBSC ) : Patients undergo donor PBSC infusion day 0 . - Graft-versus-host disease prophylaxis : Patients receive oral cyclosporine twice daily day -3 56 followed taper day 180 . Patients related stem cell donor receive oral mycophenolate mofetil twice daily day 0-28 . Patients unrelated stem cell donor receive oral mycophenolate mofetil 3 time daily day 0-28 followed taper twice daily day 56 . Patients evidence relapse persistent disease may also receive 3 donor lymphocyte infusion . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 225 patient accrue study ; 25 patient accrued Phase I 200 patient Phase II .
